title: 115_s1727
content: The "Naturalization At Training Sites Act of 2017" or the "NATS Act" establishes and uses naturalization offices at initial military training sites. The NATS Act requires the establishment of naturalization offices at initial military training sites for noncitizen members of the Armed Forces overseen by the Secretaries of Defense and Homeland Security. The NATS Act mandates the establishment of naturalization offices at military training sites overseen by the Secretaries of Defense and Homeland Security. These offices provide services to assess eligibility and suitability for citizenship, offer pathways to citizenship, and specify the required length of service for obtaining citizenship during peacetime. The NATS Act mandates the establishment of naturalization offices at military training sites overseen by the Secretaries of Defense and Homeland Security. These offices provide services to assess eligibility and suitability for citizenship, offer pathways to citizenship, and specify the required length of service for obtaining citizenship during peacetime. The application process for citizenship includes details, required materials, naturalization interview requirements, and other information under the Immigration and Nationality Act. Notifications are required during basic training, training for military specialties, and professional military education. The NATS Act mandates the establishment of naturalization offices at military training sites overseen by the Secretaries of Defense and Homeland Security. These offices provide services to assess eligibility and suitability for citizenship, offer pathways to citizenship, and specify the required length of service for obtaining citizenship during peacetime. Each Secretary concerned shall retain trained personnel at a naturalization office at every initial military training site to provide appropriate services to every member of the Armed Forces who is not a citizen of the United States. Personnel retained must be familiar with the special provisions of the Immigration and Nationality Act authorizing the expedited application and naturalization process for current members of the Armed Forces and veterans. The NATS Act mandates the establishment of naturalization offices at military training sites for current members of the Armed Forces and veterans. The Secretary concerned assigns new non-citizen members to training sites with naturalization offices. The U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Director must annually publish the number of naturalized citizens from the Armed Forces by country. The NATS Act mandates the establishment of naturalization offices at military training sites for Armed Forces members and veterans. The U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services Director must annually publish the number of naturalized citizens from the Armed Forces by country. Each Secretary concerned will define "initial military training site" in regulation.
